item.title: [Application] Spare Parts Inventory Management: A Deterministic Approach
item.description:
![[inventory.jpg]]

Efficient spare parts inventory management is a critical challenge for any organization that relies on complex equipment and continuous operations. The goal is simple in theory but difficult in practice: ensure that the right spare parts are available when needed, while keeping inventory costs under control. Achieving this balance requires making informed decisions about:

  • How much stock to hold
  • When to reorder
  • How to allocate limited budgets across multiple sites and parts

Inventory policies

A company’s choice of reordering policy depends on several critical factors: the nature of demand—whether steady, intermittent, lumpy, or seasonal; the underlying cost structure, including stockout, holding, and ordering costs; and the organization’s capability to implement advanced inventory strategies, which often require skilled personnel and sophisticated decision-support systems. item.title: About Me
item.description:
Donato Maragno

I enjoy working at the intersection of AI and mathematical optimization to turn complex data into scalable decision-making systems that drive real business value.

In 2025, I earned a PhD in Applied Mathematics and Machine Learning at the University of Amsterdam, with a thesis on Optimization with Constraint Learning (see here). I worked at MIT and Harvard on projects ranging from democratizing optimization to personalized radiotherapy planning. Currently, I work as a Scientist at Amazon on projects spanning supply chain management, logistics, production planning, and sustainability. I build optimization frameworks that are robust under uncertainty, practical and scalable for small, medium, and large industries, and able of delivering measurable impact.
